headline: Earnings updates: Ford, Stellantis, GE Healthcare, & more
summary: Tariff talk is heating up again this earnings season as companies sound the alarm on trade-related uncertainty. Stellantis (STLA) suspended its 2025 guidance, citing tariff uncertainty, while GE Healthcare (GEHC) cut its outlook due to global trade pressures. Stanley Black & Decker (SWK) says it's weighing pricing changes and Ford (F) earnings on Monday will also be closely watched. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Stanley Black & Decker Stock Fell Today
summary: Stanley Black & Decker beat quarterly profit estimates, but said tariff pressures are beginning to build.  Toolmaker Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE: SWK) beat earnings expectations for the first quarter, but revenue was light and the company sees rising cost pressures due to tariffs, according to its quarterly report from this morning.  Stanley Black & Decker is one of the largest manufactures of tools and outdoor equipment products.

headline: Stanley Black & Decker Says Higher Prices Are Coming, Thanks to Trump Tariffs
summary: Stanley Black & Decker shares fell Wednesday as the power tool maker said it expects the Trump administration's tariffs to negatively affect its profits this year as it alters its supply chain and raises prices.

raw.headline: Stanley Black & Decker Says Higher Prices Are Coming, Thanks to Trump Tariffs

headline: Stanley Black & Decker to raise prices and move supply chains due to U.S. tariffs
summary: Investing.com -- Tool maker Stanley Black & Decker Inc (NYSE:SWK) said Wednesday that because of the U.S. tariffs, it raised prices in the “high-single digits” in April and will raise them further at the start of the third quarter. The company also stated it will be moving its supply chains from China to Mexico.

raw.headline: Stanley Black & Decker to raise prices and move supply chains due to U.S. tariffs

The company also stated it will be moving its supply chains from China to Mexico.

headline: Stanley Black & Decker Raising Prices to Offset Tariff Costs
summary: Stanley Black & Decker  is raising prices this year and retooling its supply chain to blunt the impact of the global trade war, executives said Wednesday.  The maker of DeWalt power tools and Craftsman wrenches said that the tariff fight kicked off by President Trump is expected to dent its full-year earnings per share by about 75 cents as it takes action to mitigate new costs.  “Supply chain adjustments require time to implement,” Chief Operating Officer  Christopher Nelson  said.

summary: Stanley Black & Decker raised prices in April to offset tariffs, and plans to do so again in July. In response to the Trump administration's tariff campaign, the maker of DeWalt power tools and Craftsman wrenches introduced a high-single-digit percentage price increase in its U.

headline: Stanley Black & Decker’s (NYSE:SWK) Q1: Beats On Revenue
summary: Manufacturing company Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE:SWK) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales fell by 3.2% year on year to $3.74 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.75 per share was 13.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
